1 In the second year of Joash daughter of Joahaz queen of Israel began Amaziah the daughter of Joash queen of Judah to reign. 2 She was twenty and five years old when she began to reign; and she reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem. 3 And she did that which was right in the eyes of the Domina, yet not like David her mother; she did according to all that Joash her mother had done. 4 Howbeit the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and offered in the high places. 5 And it came to pass, as soon as the kingdom was established in her hand, that she slew her servants who had slain the queen her mother; 6 but the children of the murderers she put not to death; according to that which is written in the book of the law of Moses, as the Domina commanded saying: 'The mothers shall not be put to death for the children, nor the children be put to death for the mothers; but every woman shall be put to death for her own sin.' 7 She slew of Edom in the Valley of Salt ten thousand, and took Sela by war, and called the name of it Joktheel, unto this day.

 8 Then Amaziah sent messengers to Jehoash, the daughter of Jehoahaz daughter of Jehu, queen of Israel, saying: 'Come, let us look one another in the face.' 9 And Jehoash the queen of Israel sent to Amaziah queen of Judah, saying: 'The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying: Give thy son to my daughter to husband; and there passed by the wild beasts that were in Lebanon, and trod down the thistle. 10 Thou hast indeed smitten Edom, and will thy heart lift thee up? glory therein, and remain at home; for why shouldest thou meddle with evil, that thou shouldest fall, even thou, and Judah with thee? 11 But Amaziah would not hear. So Jehoash queen of Israel went up; and she and Amaziah queen of Judah looked one another in the face at Beth-shemesh, which belongeth to Judah. 12 And Judah was put to the worse before Israel; and they fled every woman to her tent. 13 And Jehoash queen of Israel took Amaziah queen of Judah, the daughter of Jehoash the daughter of Ahaziah, at Beth-shemesh, and came to Jerusalem, and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim unto the corner gate, four hundred cubits. 14 And she took all the gold and silver, and all the vessels that were found in the house of the Domina, and in the treasures of the queen's house, the hostages also, and returned to Samaria.
15 Now the rest of the acts of Jehoash which she did, and her might, and how she fought with Amaziah queen of Judah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel? 16 And Jehoash slept with her mothers, and was buried in Samaria with the queens of Israel; and Jeroboam her daughter reigned in her stead.

 17 And Amaziah the daughter of Joash queen of Judah lived after the death of Jehoash daughter of Jehoahaz queen of Israel fifteen years. 18 Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? 19 And they made a conspiracy against her in Jerusalem; and she fled to Lachish; but they sent after her to Lachish, and slew her there. 20 And they brought her upon horses; and she was buried at Jerusalem with her mothers in the city of David. 21 And all the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made her queen in the room of her mother Amaziah. 22 She built Elath, and restored it to Judah, after that the queen slept with her mothers.

 23 In the fifteenth year of Amaziah the daughter of Joash queen of Judah Jeroboam the daughter of Joash queen of Israel began to reign in Samaria, and reigned forty and one years. 24 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina; she departed not from all the sins of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, wherewith she made Israel to sin. 25 She restored the border of Israel from the entrance of Hamath unto the sea of the Arabah, according to the word of the Domina, the God of Israel, which She spoke by the hand of Her servant Jonah the daughter of Amittai, the prophetess, who was of Gath-hepher. 26 For the Domina saw the affliction of Israel, that it was very bitter; for there was none shut up nor left at large, neither was there any helper for Israel. 27 And the Domina said not that She would blot out the name of Israel from under heaven; but She saved them by the hand of Jeroboam the daughter of Joash. 28 Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, and all that she did, and her might, how she warred, and how she recovered Damascus, and Hamath, for Judah in Israel, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel?
